website_summaries.verdict: With its large size and realistic features, the KidKraft Uptown Kitchen is a nice playset, especially for more than one child. However, parents will want to check into buying other accessories for the kitchen.
pros: The KidKraft Uptown Espresso Kitchen is large enough to allow more than one child to play at a time
It features a refrigerator/freezer, oven, four-burner stove, dishwasher, sink and microwave
cons: The assembly time is lengthy -- some users said four to six hours
The kitchen does not come with any cooking accessories, although kits are available online

customer_reviews.title: Best Toy Kitchen Ever!!! Be sure to buy the matching accessories
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this kitchen and bought all the espresso accessories to match. Building it takes 4-6 hours so don't make this the last thing on your to do list. The knobs for turning on the oven make clicking noises and shouldn't be turned to fast or else you can strip them (truly no big deal). The design is modern and soft on the eyes. We made ours more realistic by adding battery operated led touch lights to the microwave, oven, refrigerator, freezer and above the range (see photos). Hope this review is helpful
customer_reviews.author: V.P. Sterling

customer_reviews.title: GREAT KITCHEN! TAKE YOUR TIME PUTTING IT TOGETHER!
customer_reviews.text: I looooove the look of this kitchen! I won't know how much my daughter will enjoy it until after tomorrow (this is her Christmas present)..... So I will update later! I've included some notes from a few pages of the instructions to help others with which color screws to use at what time (either bronze/brown or silver). Also a couple notes of things that I ran into that I had to fix during assembly! I hope the notes help! I took almost a full day (8 hours) to put this together because my husband and I took our time and our daughter was up during this time!
customer_reviews.author: Jada Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Christmas nightmare!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so upset with this purchase I bought this for my 3 year old daughter for Christmas. On Christmas eve we went to put this together and there was no screws whatsoever in the box we couldn't put it together and we bought everything you could imagine to go with this kitchen and my daughter could let use any of it. This was her main present and needless to say it ruined her Christmas morning. Thanks for nothing kid Kraft you've disappointed once again!!!! Dont buy this unless you're looking for full disappointment!!!
customer_reviews.author: vannessa bailey

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Very nice kitchen set! However the part that was put together by the manufacturer was assembled wrong therefore we was unable to assemble it because of that!! Was soooo disappointed and so was my 4 year old niece that had looked so forward to this set! Secondly, the PAIN & INCONVENIENCE of having to pack it up and return! And it’s a very heavy set, when delivered it took 2 people!!! Sooo DISAPPOINTED, but most of all the disappointment of my 4 yr old niece!!
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Jones

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and finish and dramatic price change
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in time, my daughter was looking forward it. On opening the carton, I was quite disappointed with the quality of the product. It was damaged at various places and finishing around the edges was quite poor. Kids products should not be build like this. The other point where I was very disappointed was that I paid $177.98 (without taxes) and the price dropped to $139.99(without taxes) in just 10 days. If the price of the product can fall by $40 in a matter of 10 days, there is surely something not right!!
customer_reviews.author: Aman

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts Major Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Kitchen came as a Christmas gift. Waited to open it the night before so my husband could put it together. First thing he noticed was there were no instructions. So I pulled them up online by the product number. As he’s going through to check that all the parts were there the bag with screws was missing. Not one single piece of hardware. A lot of our other gifts were to go with the actual kitchen. It’s extrmely disappointing to have to have our 6 year old wake up on Christmas Day with an empty space in his room for a kitchen we couldn’t assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Trista A.

customer_reviews.title: Finished product amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I disliked the fact that two of the pieces were cracked. I went ahead and put the kitchen together so I really hope that the quality of the pieces are good and my granddaughter can enjoy this set for a long time. While I wasn’t all that impressed with the instructions given (YouTube has a somewhat how to do version - thanks to a customer) and many many pieces - I must say the finished product (all put together) is amazing. This takes two people to put together and about 7 hours with breaks so you don’t get frustrated and just decide shipping it back is easier. Motivation to continue was 2 1/2 year old granddaughter and someone helping me.
customer_reviews.author: YourAverageBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap disposable garbage
customer_reviews.text: This product looks nice however, its disposable garbage like everything else made in China. My 3 and 4 year Olds have broke the doors off. Just one more piece of crap that I purchased for my children that only lasted a few months. Why do we as Americans continue to pay good money for disposable toys? Because we love our children? Look how cheap everything is made today. Awful! Something must be done.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Not so great to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a granddaughter. She and her older siblings (ages9-13) love it. It looks great and seems to be sturdy. The price is very fair. The big downside is the construction. It takes time, effort, and skill to put it together. The only directions are pictures - nothing written. If you plan to give this as a gift, make sure it arrives a few days before the event to allow ample time for assembly. DON’T start this after your child goes to bed on Christmas Eve. Watch for the two different heads on the screws. Use the brown ones for areas that will be exposed. (That’s a minor cosmetic thing.)
customer_reviews.author: Country Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: We were really excited about this kitchen. Sorry to report that some of the pieces came scratched badly. I attached pictures. We started putting it together before we saw he pieces. I would not recommend this item. There are cheaper kitchens with better quality. Edited- Upon completion of putthing this kitchen together: It's missing 2 sets of screws that put the chalk board and ice maker together. Re-rated to one star from 2.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Built like a brick outhouse.
customer_reviews.text: The Assembly of this product it's quite time-consuming and a bit challenging. However I believe that's a testament to the build quality of the product. And it is built very well. It's built like a piece of furniture I would buy for my home. I could see this product lasting until my three-year-old daughter has a three-year-old daughter of her own. I really am quite impressed. Furthermore about the assembly, the instructions are not perfect but they're good enough to get it done. I would definitely recommend assembly without distractions.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Neuser

customer_reviews.title: Do not read this
customer_reviews.text: It was a pain to assemble. However, I blame thst on builder (me). However, the but, bolt and screw manufacture needs to have a talking to. Inside threads to many were completely heinous, and if you only used the tools(which i did not less than 5 screws in) that it came with be prepared to have major calluses on your fingers. Seriously. Like alot. But after 4 days, mostly because every time i looked at it i thought of the irritating screw packaging it came in. In the end, kiddo loves his kitchen. He better. And he better become a chef...because i deserve an awesome meal, not made out of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: It's beautiful, fun and well built
customer_reviews.text: My 4 granddaughters and I give this 5 stars!! It's absolutely beautiful, well made and we have so much fun playing. Love the storage and you can actually fit a tray in the oven. I shouldn't ever need to replace this kitchen set. When it arrived some of the pieces were scratched, but Kidkraft totally took care of it. The replacement parts were quickly sent out and the hubby was able to put it all together. Be methodical when assembling. It takes some time but is well worth it. Your kids will not be disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: MarieAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase to last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing gift I bought for my son’s birthday. He absolutely loves it. Assembly; only oneproblem I found during assembly was mixing the copper screws with the silver ones. Otherwise very easy to follow directions as long as you don’t force any screws you should not have any stripping. There is so much space to fit all the play items that go with a kitchen. I added lights to make it a little more real for my son and daughter. The durability makes me happy to know this will last for both my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Proud Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen, easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to write a too long text, so I keep it short: Stay away if you are not able to change a light bulb, otherwise have someone helping you to hold the parts. The step by step instructions are very clear, every part is marked and it is easy to put together. The only thing you should be aware of is that there are brown and silver screws. Use all the brown ones on visible parts and the silver ones inside. Otherwise it took me about 2 hours to put it together, with the help of my 3.5 year old son.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Play Kitchen for Toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to buy a pretend kitchen for your toddler then look no further, this is an amazing sturdy kitchen. It's very spacious and modern looking. Just do your self a favor and prepare to spend 3 to 4 hours to assemble it. Pro tip: Put out all parts and arrange it from 1 - 45 to make your life simple, another thing I found out that it does not have a number 17 part so don't waste 20 mins like me looking for it. All in all its time consuming but easy to assemble and a sturdy kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing and sturdy toddler kitchen! I personally attempted to assemble and realized there was no way. I had to ask a family member to help assemble and it took him a good 3 hours to assemble. DEFINITELY have an experienced person to help with assembly. Instructions aren’t the best. But the product is AMAZING! I had NO missing pieces and everything was packaged EXTREMELY well. I was very appreciative of the packaging. My children LOVE this kitchen so much!
customer_reviews.author: Holli

customer_reviews.title: Took wife and me about 2.5 hours. Not too bad!
customer_reviews.text: Took my wife and me about 2.5 hours to put together! And I used a regular manual screwdriver. We win! Just kidding. She read the instructions and told me where to screw. Easy peasy! Definitely would’ve taken longer if I tried to do it myself. 1. Make sure brown screws are used for the correct side. 2. My kids broke something within 12 hours of playing with it. Nothing a little super glue couldn’t fix. 3. Easy to move with another person. 4. Kids love it!
customer_reviews.author: So

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen for years to come!
customer_reviews.text: This is beautiful! Assembly was, as described, lengthy, but not too difficult. The kitchen is sturdy and my toddler loves it. Pros: - sturdy - looks great - easy to use - won’t be outgrown for years to come Cons: - no sounds or lights - doesn’t come with any accessories, so take that into account for budget
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged - very hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged. We paid top Dollar for this kitchen, it should arrive in perfect condition. My wife and I are experts at assembling furniture and it took us almost three hours to complete.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING KITCHEN
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is amazing. We bought it for my 2 year old daughter for her birthday. Needless to say it was a success. She loves playing in the kitchen when we’re in the kitchen so it was only right. There were a few minor scratches on one of the knobs but nothing to deduct a star. My husband and I put it together in 4hrs. We wanted to be precise so we took our time. I recommend having nothing to do when taking on this project as well as an extra set of hands to help.
customer_reviews.author: Misha

customer_reviews.title: Great for storage and endless fun
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (23 mos.) has had this kitchen for four months. We’re so happy with the purchase. She loves “washing her hands” in the sink and “drying them” with a towel on the towel rack, and she enjoys exploring all the different cubbies inside the kitchen. The cubbies are so useful for storage - we keep a bunch of books and toys inside. It’s a quality piece, sturdy, and the cabinets open nicely. It took my husband 4-5 hours to put together, but the process was smooth even though it was long. It looks really nice in a playroom, too. Very pleased with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey A.

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift Ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful play kitchen. My 3yo LOVES it! We nicknamed her "The Destroyer" for a reason lol but this kitchen has stood firm! My husband put it together in about 4 hours. Went pretty smoothly. There was one plank of wood that was chipped, but he contacted the company and they immediately sent a replacement part at no extra cost. Quick and easy. I looked at a LOT of reviews for a LOT of different play kitchens on Amazon. It was a nail biter for sure, considering it was a Christmas gift that I was buying online and couldnt see in person. But we have been really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: What a Task to build it!
customer_reviews.text: Omg! This was a pain to put together. It took me and my spouse 3 hrs to put together. You literally have to drill/screw every single piece together , even stuff that should've already came attached like the handles, etc. Once we put it together it was worth it to see our lil one play excitedly. It is very sturdy and seems like it will last so it's something she can have for a long time. I gave it 4 stars only because it was soo much to put together. I expected some assembly but not the whole thing. We literally built the kitchen set from scratch. Nothing came assembled.
customer_reviews.author: S.E

customer_reviews.title: Some assembly required.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice toddlers kitchen play unit. The great grand kids love it. I would recommend to family and friends. The entire unit comes in one box and due to it’s weight, I recommend a 2 man lift. Each piece was numbered. The assembly sheets are pictorial only with no written instructions. It took me about 4 hours assembly time. If you have never assembled something of this scale, I would recommend someone to assist and to study the pictorials carefully before beginning this task. Have fun, life is short😁
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful play kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old daughter wanted a new kitchen as her old one was falling apart. This one is PERFECT! It's absolutely beautiful and fits right with our home decor. It also has a lot of great features - my daughter especially loves the pegs and the shelf beside the microwave. It has lots of storage space in the fridge & freezer. The oven and dishwasher are very roomy and can hold tons of dishes, etc. My daughter really loves playing with this kitchen. I really have no complaints other than the fridge door takes an extra push to close all the way. It will latch but it takes a little extra effort. I don't think this is typical though.
customer_reviews.author: Aby Runyan

customer_reviews.title: Perect for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: I debated for days on which play kitchen to get my toddler. I ended up choosing this one because it looked the most sturdy and looked like something we could have around for years, compared to the cheap appearance of some play kitchens. This kitchen took about 2 hours to assemble with 2 adult males not taking it too serious. So far my 2 year old has used this for 6 months and has yet to break anything so it's really constructed well. Also, he's attempted climbing on it and let me tell you, this thing doesn't tip over like I was worried it would. The fridge is huge and there is pull out shelves in the oven and dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as reviewers say
customer_reviews.text: This is not nearly as good as i was hoping. A nightmare to put together. The boards we scratched and used looking. Hardware missing. They are cheap and give some brown screws and some plain metal. So you constantly have to make sure you arent wasting a brown one that will be hidden because the instructions wont help you.
customer_reviews.author: Gary H

customer_reviews.title: Kidcraft shipped us the parts quickly and without fuss - so excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the box we realized we were missing a few pieces. Kidcraft shipped us the parts quickly and without fuss - so excellent customer service! The kitchen itself is nice but not nearly as awesome as the reviews made it out to be. The sink and faucet are really cheap plastic, and neither fit snugly into the kitchen... They are kind of wobbly. The rest of the kitchen is pretty sturdy and guests are always impressed by how realistic it looks. I bought it during a sale and I'm glad I didn't pay retail cost as I don't feel it's worth that much.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyTop Contributor: Children's Books

customer_reviews.title: Came pretty dirty
customer_reviews.text: The pieces came dirty (not like warehouse dust but like actual black and brown streaks on some pieces, large smudges, and some pieces were chipped). But my son had already seen the kitchen and was so excited so I wasn't going to deal with the hassle of returning it to wait for a new one. It took a long time to put it together after I cleaned everything off but otherwise it looks like the picture and does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Kit Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Best Kitchen for Older Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, but expect to spend a few hours on assembly. This is one of the tallest and sturdiest kitchens available at this price point. My six year old and 4 year old share it well. And it stores all the food and dishes, which is also a plus.
customer_reviews.author: JaimeTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Play Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This play kitchen is just as pictured. The package is very heavy because the kitchen is made of good quality materials. It takes several hours to assemble but actually comes with extra fittings (screws, bolts) so that you will not find yourself missing anything as you assemble it. When assembled, all of the doors work very well and the knobs make realistic sounds (clicking). We have only had it for a few days but so far it is a wonderful playset, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! But be prepared for major assembly!
customer_reviews.text: Totally agree, assembly is a pain! But thankfully that was done by super awesome husband... over several hours!( he remodels homes) but this had lots of tiny screws and random pieces.and literally needed every piece to be put together. But kids LoVE it! And I love that it looks so cute in the play room!!! This thing is solid! So heavy! Lots of storage and fun knobs. This kitchen makes me want to remodel mine. Got it on sale for $93.00... money well spent! Would have paid more. Great quality. I got the kid craft dish set also. Very impressed! Good enough to use for real! Perfect size. Not too big, but not too small. And not cheap or flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Love to clean!

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Quality product. Lots of pieces to put together taking patience on my part. But once assembled was worth the time and effort. Grandaughter loved it. You will also see in the photos other Amazon purchases that were a hit - coffee maker, dishes, cookware. One drawback was the price which varied as much as $100 from various sellers. Also make sure to check pieces and parts upon delivery. My first delivery was damaged but Amazon sent me a replacement within 3 days,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap hardwear
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present for my daughter and had to assemble Christmas Eve! This took me so long and had to use multiple of my own screw to replace ones that they sent that would break and I would have to struggle removing! So glad I will never have to put one of these together again
customer_reviews.author: kristin marie jamerson

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but takes forever to put together
customer_reviews.text: Comes in a bajillion parts and took 4 1/2 hours to put together (not kidding...took 2 1/2 movies). And that was working nonstop. Sturdy and very pretty once done. I think it'll hold up to kid play, but it should come with a warning that it's way more than a bit of assembly required. This is a serious job to put together. Also, does NOT come with any pots/pans/food items to play with. So, if your kid needs those for the kitchen you need to get separately.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Girl Z

customer_reviews.title: It's not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The kitchen is beautiful but it's hard to built especially because the makers made a mistake on the door hinges I had to fix it myself by flipping the hinges backwards and drilling new holes in. It's really unfortunate especially because its 150 dollars. I was not able to return it because my niece was excited to play with it and i did not want to make her wait any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jose l.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth time spent on assembly
customer_reviews.text: So glad I read all reviews and watched the videos. It took 2 of us at least 5 hours to assemble but it was totally worth it. My grand daughter LOVES it and plays with it daily. Worth every minute of time and penny spent for it.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia SS

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed with this product! I bought this for my daughter. Although she loves the kitchen, it has not withstood her use. The towel bar broke off as well as the door to the oven during the first week of use! Most extremely upsetting thing was that when she closed the Refrigerator door she caught her finger in it and bruised it. Absolutely terrible product!!! Would not buy or recommend to any. The company should be ashamed to sell such trash!
customer_reviews.author: RETURNTOSENDER

customer_reviews.title: Love this Kitchen and Great Customer Service from KidKraft!
customer_reviews.text: I can't express how much I love this kitchen. Santa brought it for my daughter for Christmas this year! (18 months old) and it was a huge hit. Took about 3.5 hours for Hubby and my dad to assemble. Realized that we were short a few parts (locking screws) at the end when attempting to attach the top (microwave and shelf portion). Of course, this was being built the weekend before Christmas... we called first thing Monday morning, KidKraft sent us the ENTIRE parts package, 2nd day!!! Received it Thursday and finished assembly in no time. Added the IKEA pots and pans set which fit perfectly!. Little one has been playing non-stop! Wonderful customer service from KidKraft as well!
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: Cute, simple kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Great little kitchen! I purchased the kidKraft Uptown Espresso Kitchen to give to our 20 month old this Christmas. My husband and my dad assembled it this evening in approximately 4 hrs. They said it wasn’t very painful, they just had to organize in the beginning, which was essential. My only company is a scratch on the front of the refrigerator that was discovered upon removing from the box. The door of the refrigerator was wrapped in a protective sleeve, so the demagnetized was done prior to boxing. It’s nothing a little silver magic marker wouldn’t fix. I think our daughter is going to love this!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany S

customer_reviews.title: Modern Kitchen - Some Defects
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good looking modern kitchen. Negatives: small amount of counter space and only knobs turn. Would be cooler if at the least the buttons were push-able on the phone and microwave. Also, our product came a little damaged as some notated. It had a huge 2ft stain with a metal piece sticking out on the side. Was very close to returning but it was so close to Christmas we decided we'd fix on our own. Hammered in the random metal piece but could not get the weird stain off unfortunately. Just feels like for the price this kind of quality control should be in place.
customer_reviews.author: Carla90

customer_reviews.title: Pleased, but rubbish instructions
customer_reviews.text: So, I'm pleased with the end product, but the instructions are absolutely horrible. The worst of any self-assembled furniture piece I've ever assembled. Whomever KidKraft paid to put the instructions together needs to be re-assigned to a new position. But, now that it's together, my kids like it, it's sturdy enough (WalMart/IKEA), and it's cute to look at. Also, I now have 100+ fake food items all strewn across my living room (not included)...
customer_reviews.author: Micah333

customer_reviews.title: Looks so realistic!
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons love it. There were some chips on the panel surfaces but nothing a black or silver sharpie couldn’t fix! Very happy with the “food and dishware storage”! All the adults that see it think it’s awesome and want to ”play with it” too🤪
customer_reviews.author: Carla Prepejchal

customer_reviews.title: OVERALL SATASFIED
customer_reviews.text: Be sure you set aside some time to put this bad boy together and grab a friend! Directions were not as user friendly as I would have liked but they got the job done. One piece was damaged/scuffed when I opened the box but returning it would have been much harder than just fixing/painting that one piece! I used a drill like the reviews suggested and broke a screw off in one of the handles (be careful). One of the only things I thought could/would be better and or more fun for the kids would be either battery powered lights or some sort of electronic sounds to make it feel more "realistic" but overall I would suggest this product!
customer_reviews.author: K Moore

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I read this was very hard to put together. After receiving it I was overwhelmed with all the little pieces. The instructions aren't super clear either. But I did most of it on my own, there is a few places you'll need help, in about 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Aesthetically it is pleasing to the eye. My kids love playing with it. Keeps them entertained for hours.
customer_reviews.author: MandieWebb

customer_reviews.title: Some parts missing but nice overall
customer_reviews.text: A few minor pieces were missing so thus the four versus five star review. By the time we laid everything out and began assembling, it wasn’t really prudent to stop, box it up and process a return for a few missing bits. However - isn’t it a minimal ask that ALL pieces be included? It took 3 hours to assemble with power tools. Lots of work but the kitchen is nice. I hope it holds up - our toddler son is quite exuberant and physical with his toys... :) All in all, seems like good value for what you get. B+
customer_reviews.author: JenJenJen

customer_reviews.title: A lot of work
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a good deal but the price is so low because it takes an entire day to put together. Some of these pieces could have already been put on seriously. Pieces that would normally come together (small screws gadgets etc) were not. You basically built the whole thing from the ground up and paid for the wood. Super cute but no lights noises etc. pay an extra $30-40 and hire someone from task rabbit to assemble it. It also didn’t come with any dishes or food. IKEA has them for cheap do not get fake food from amazon
customer_reviews.author: Alyce

customer_reviews.title: This kitchen is perfect for my 3 and 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is perfect for my 3 and 6 year old. It is very sturdy! We bought this as a Christmas gift and waited until xmas eve to put it together.... not so smart! It took my husband and I over 2 hrs to put it together. While it was time consuming, the instructions were easy to follow and the assembly was smooth. I would recommend having 2 people for assembly as certain steps required help to hold pieces together. The set is exactly as pictured and the details from the "granite" counters were a very pleasant surprise! It really is just the cutest!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kitchen, nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The counter top arrived missing holes, like to place the faucet and stove knobs, I had to drill the holes myself, overall though this kitchen is great, my nieces love it. Definitely takes 3-4 hours building, and majority are the time it’s u looking at the instructions. I recommend looking at a YouTube video for some help. Goood luck
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Lot of pieces to put together....but worth it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this kitchen. My sister and her financies put it together for my daughters birthday.There was a lot of arguing and a lot of pieces. But it came out great. Holds a lot of items, the knobs turn and making clicking sounds. On the fridge e chalk board is a actual chalk board and we are able to write on it. Also my 1 year old and 4 year old can both play with it and not get in each other way. Worth the money.👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: gloria

customer_reviews.title: The kitchen itself is sturdy and good quality
customer_reviews.text: The kitchen itself is sturdy and good quality. The details are great. The reason I gave this 3 stars.....it takes HOURS to put this little kitchen together. My husband and I both have post-graduate degrees.....and it took hours. Also...a few pieces of hardware/bolts were bent on arrival requiring us to obtain new ones at the hardware store. Also the instructions are poor. The pictures are black and white with limited wording....only picture instruction. Wish there was an option to pay extra and have it delivered assembled. At this point we would have just paid the extra cash to get an assembled one from Pottery Barn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I received this item with high expectations and upon opening the box and inspecting the contents I'm very disappointed. There are several of the large panels that had deep and long scratches in them. Also, on panel #1 there was a large gouge on it and a poor attempt was made to repair or hide the defect instead of replacing prior to shipping out to be sold. On panel #2 there are deep scratches and on panel #9 there are scratches that are over 6" long.... This wasn't found until Christmas Eve when I was putting the Kitchen together for my daughter to receive Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome kids' kitchen! This thing has a TON of parts and takes 4-6 hours to assemble, but the instructions are clear and thorough. Nothing complicated about it. Our packaging was damaged enough that I took photos, but the contents are fine. We love it and hope that our daughter does, too.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 year old loved it. He plays a bit rough so this sturdy kitchenette is perfect! His little sister will also get to use it when she is able to walk. It took my husband 2.5 hours to assemble. All the doors open, the shelves come out if you want to. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mart

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Straightforward Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I finished putting this together last night, even as a mechanical engineer it took me a solid 2 hours to assemble. I was impressed with the rigidity of the board and fasteners in the places that need more support. I look forward to many years of fun for our little one. Instructions were straightforward easy to follow along with pictures for every little step along the way. It meets all my expectations for quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: We've had this little kitchen for over a year now and our daughter loves it. She's almost three and uses it every day. The materials are good quality and it's hard to tell we've had it this long. There's plenty of room inside for all the play food, dishes, and more. We use shoe box size storage bins to keep everything organized and there's still room to spare. The knobs and doors all still work great even down to the clicking noise the stove and oven knobs make when turned. It's an adorable kitchen and I can see it continuing as a fantastic play space for our daughter for several years.
customer_reviews.author: ShinyBaubles

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Took 3 hours plus to put together! My 3 years old daughter loves it! I had to buy some led lights to make more realistic but it keeps the kids busy!!! It’s heavy and it takes some space!
customer_reviews.author: Nikos  batsos

customer_reviews.title: Very nice kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I will admit, this project redefined "some assembly required," but the directions were easy to follow (not like something from Ikea) and it took about an hour for me to assemble. Warning, the box weighs a ton!!! So don't plan on moving it by yourself, you'll need some help. I had to unpack everything in the living room and cary it piece by piece upstairs, but it was worth it. The final product is truly outstanding. Well made, high quality, and high detail.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, building it is a little frustrating
customer_reviews.text: This took me 3.5 hours to build, I was not in a rush but rather taking my time. I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5 because there were some small steps the manufacturer could have pre-assembled and some bolts were cheap and the thread would almost strip. Word of caution, do not apply too much force on any bolt or screw. Other than that, it's very cute and extremely functional, doors all close and latch well, and even though it's compressed board wood, it's very sturdy. Overall it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Arango

customer_reviews.title: Good play kitchen, lots of assembly required.
customer_reviews.text: This took a while to put together, but it turned out great. Sturdy and my kids are not the most gentle kids. There did seem to be a lot of pieces that ended up being screwed in that would have been fine with a latch type system that would have saved some time, but overall easy to follow directions and a great size play kitchen for a 3-6 year old.
customer_reviews.author: D Bogan

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, beautiful, and well-made!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well-made play kitchen! It took us about 2 & 1/2 hours to put together. The directions were only pictorial, but they were easy to follow and understand. This unit is extremely sturdy and it looks beautiful! We have had 3 children playing with this set at the same time without any problems. I highly recommend this play kitchen!! Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Worth the time consuming assembly
customer_reviews.text: This monster is a notch above just about every play kitchen I have seen. The reviews regarding assembly time are accurate. I believe I invested somewhere north of three hours (while being distracted by Christmas movies.) The instructions were simple and easy to follow, and the only stressful moment I had was when placing the bar portion on, as I was uncertain of which bolts needed to tighten first. Once built, this thing is great, and should last through my kids and grandkids.
customer_reviews.author: Drew G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Storage, Sturdy, multi-kid friendly
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kitchen. I researched a ton of different ones and decided on this one mainly because of the storage. Most other kitchens have tiny compartments. If we’re going to have this take up space in our small house, I want it to hold all the food/dishes that go with it! And it easily does with room to spare. I also like that it is wide and my two kids can both play with it at the same time. It is pretty straight forward assembly, but did take me and my husband about 4 hours to put together. My 4 and 2 year old have loved it and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but set aside time for assembly!
customer_reviews.text: The end result is great, but it will take a couple of hours to fully assemble. It is reasonably solid once complete, but one weak spot is the plastic "pole" - it is not the sturdiest of attachment points, so don't lift the kitchen set by the top part once assembled. Also, note different colors of screws; these can work interchangeably, but they are intended for different parts to blend in better with the parts they fasten - the instructions do not make this plain but are otherwise easy enough to follow.
customer_reviews.author: John F Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty,  quality product... and my son LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow... This took us forever (over 3 hours for 2 educated people) to put together but for good reason... This is a quality piece. The only reason I give it 4 stars and not 5... there are 2 colors of the exact same screw. Instructions don't tell you which ones to use when. We tried our best to guess but got some wrong... so we have some silver screws showing instead of the darker screws. Not a deal breaker but stuff like this drives me crazy. We realized the color issue too late in the build to go back and fix it.
customer_reviews.author: HTHONLINE

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Even though it took my husband and me about 4 hours to assemble this little kitchen, I must say that it is the cutest darned thing that I have ever seen. Hubby and I worked nonstop and are so glad that I ordered this specific product. All of the pieces went together perfectly and there were all of the pieces that we would need to make it safe and secure. Thank you KidKraft for such an awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Cute kitchen crappy parts. Broke in less than 2 weeks after Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this kitchen for Christmas and after playing with it for less than 2 weeks the fridge door broke off and the little piece that they installed to allow it to swing broke off. I'm pretty sad that her big present is already broke from normal use. This is a part that the Kidskraft already has installed on the door and something should be made a little stronger!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Know what you're getting into...
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is fabulous! Great little details, lots of storage. Not too small. My 35" toddler has to stand on her tip toes to use the microwave cabinet. Room to grow. Great value. HOWEVER... I agree with other reviewers that you need to set aside no less than 4 hours to assemble this thing. If putting together IKEA furniture is your idea of Hell, this is a lot like that. The instructions are easier than IKEA's tend to be, but there are SO. MANY. PARTS. Get a hand screwdriver with a ratcheting mechanism to make the work a little easier. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Brad B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome kitchen set that probably looks better than my kitchen. It has lots of storage space to put all the little kitchen related toys. Just be ready to spend some time assembling the kitchen. I think it took him close to 2 hours to put the whole thing together. If there's an option at checkout, it might be worthwhile to add assembly so you don't have to deal with the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: kjammer123

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.  Very difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this more stars. I really do. But after I was up until 2am putting this damn thing together I can’t. The build and materials are great quality. Very solid once it’s put together correctly. Thing is, the directions are lacking and unclear. This is by far the most complicated kids toy I have ever put together. More details and maybe even written out words instead of just pictures in the directions. 4hr build time!
customer_reviews.author: Tim M.

customer_reviews.title: We all love this kitchen
customer_reviews.text: We all love this kitchen! My daughter just turned 2 and we use a step stool for her but she loves it and play with it every day! Putting it tiger takes about 3 hrs but worth it! We put it together at night and surprised her in the Morgan's she was definitely surprised and has loved it since day one. What helped my husband is that I laid out all of the pieces on our couch by order of number. So when he needed the pieces it was easy for me to find the ones he needed every step of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Tinkerbell

customer_reviews.title: Quality fun product! Takes 4 hours to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: It is a very well made and high quality product. It fits in a smaller space than I expected as the width dimensions account an extra few inches for counter space that juts out a little. Just please keep in mind. It is a SOLID four hours to assemble. That is with two adults working with no break at a normal pace. Still very worth the price-just set aside the time!
customer_reviews.author: The_B_Family

customer_reviews.title: I felt like I needed to be a master carpenter
customer_reviews.text: Yikes; this thing is a bear to build. I felt like I needed to be a master carpenter. The instructions are not clear and there are a billion parts and pieces. Our marriage was hanging by a thread by the time we finished and I still wince every time I look at this kitchen. But our kiddo does love it so it's all worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: My kids absolutely love this play kitchen. We have two kids ranging in age from toddler to kindergarten and we replaced their old play kitchen with this one because the old one was tiny and pretty much for babies. This was assembled by one person in less than 4 hours, it was actually pretty easy to put together, and my kids were instantly taken with it. I love that it's big enough for them to play with it TOGETHER. No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: this is just an excellent product and there's a reason many parents see it ...
customer_reviews.text: Assembling this was a real test of our marriage (we passed) because the instructions aren't as clear as they could be. However, this is just an excellent product and there's a reason many parents see it as the gold standard of play kitchens. The kids have real paper towels on their paper towel rack, which come in handy for real messes in their play room. This is tall enough that my 7-year-old son can play with it; my toddler can't really reach things we set on top of the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: eaAK

customer_reviews.title: Well built kids kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Kitchen is well built and cute. My 6 and 7 yrs old taller for their ages but still able to play. They will be able to use it a few more years. I got containers at the storage company and sensor lights from Ali Express. Husband put all together quick - he does assemble for living. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: love2fly

customer_reviews.title: Modern kitchen encourages TONS of creative play...and LOOKS great in our home!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE our kidkraft uptown espresso kitchen! It matches our home perfectly, and has super cute features. The real chalk board on the fridge is a lot of fun, and the speckled countertop is adorable! My 2 year old son has been playing with it non stop, and while he is tall enough to reach everything, he will certainly not outgrow it any time soon! Another reviewer placed tap lights in the oven, fridge, microwave and above the stove, and I will be doing that too! GENIUS IDEA! :-)
customer_reviews.author: lovedbeyondmeasure

customer_reviews.title: Pure joy for little ones
customer_reviews.text: It took my husband and I 5 hours to put this thing together and we're still married so that's something. We read the tips in other reviews. The most important thing to note is that there are multiple screws labeled exactly the same but some are painted and some are not. Be sure to use the painted screws on the outside. The instructions don't tell you when to use the painted screws and the package doesn't clearly identify where the painted screws are located within it. Our kid loves this thing and the pure joy we witnessed at the unveiling was absolutely priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect set!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 4 year old niece for Christmas. UPS delivered it at 2:02pm and I started assembling it right away. I finished at 7:48pm. Overall, the pictorial instructions were easy to follow. If I had some help assembling it, I probably would’ve finished in 3 hours or so lol. It’s very heavy and sturdy and perfect. As you can see, I’ve upgraded her “kitchen” lol. Note, the pots and utensils were not included. Can’t wait until my niece sees it!!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Stew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter's second birthday. I wanted a kitchen that would not be an eyesore in my family room and I think I chose well. Based on the reviews I read, my biggest worry was building it, but while it was time consuming, I was able to do it all practically by myself. Instructions are like the Ikea type where it's just pictures. The pieces were labeled and the tools were nicely sorted and organized. People assume I spent a lot more on this kitchen than I actually did.
customer_reviews.author: Susanna

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s a cute little kitchen. The problem is the door of the “microwave” and “freezer” keeps coming off. I don’t know if that has something to do with my husband not putting it on good enough or what. Maybe my kids are super rough or it’s cheaply made; I’m not sure. They’ve only had it a few weeks so that’s not a good look. Edit: It’s slowly falling apart. Kids removed sink and water faucet. I personally wouldn’t recommend but then again I have some strange kids.
customer_reviews.author: ThighQueen

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a Christmas present for our grandchildren aged 4 and 20 mos. My husband put it together in about 2.5 hours. He has put together his fair share of IKEA furniture for our family which I’m sure helped. He laid it all out 1st and followed instructions. He said it was well made, all the holes lines up, and all the pieces were undamaged. We are both impressed with how nice it is. It is heavy to carry and does take time.
customer_reviews.author: merritt16

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be the BEST!!! My granddaughter loves it! I bought a little pots and pan set with a chef suit to go with it. It took 2 hours to put it together but I didn’t mind because the directions were clear and all the pieces were in the kit. Thank you for making by baby girl so happy during COVID.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A nice looking play kitchen
customer_reviews.text: A nice looking play kitchen, however a hanging knob broke when screwing it on leaving me with three knobs instead of four. Instructions can be a bit confusing and there is no color picture to look at for an example. There are also some colored screws, but no guide as to where they should be used and I was not aware some of them were colored until after I had begun assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put together.
customer_reviews.text: Looked great after assembling it. It took my dad and my husband 7 hours to put this together. The refrigerator door was upside down if the hinge was followed- good thing my dad and husband are handy people and they fixed it. Don't buy this if you are not handy. You will never get this together. It looks really complicated. Now if you have people to assemble it- it's a nice quality product. They should also be flexible enough to adjust just in case there are errors in the product itself. I knocked out 2 stars for difficulty assembling it.
customer_reviews.author: Bejeweled

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 toddlers 4 months ago. Yesterday one of my kids opened the fridge door and it broke completely off. I can't screw it back in because the cheap particle board snapped. What a waste of money. Do yourself a favor and don't buy this junk. Amazon says I can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Great for storage
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen is adorable! I love the sink and stove. I love that the oven and dishwasher have a rollout shelf (like real ones do) and I love all the storage space. Our kitchens in the past had very little storage and it was a pain to keep the accessories from being spread all over the room. My only complaints are that the buttons on the dishwasher and microwave are painted on and putting it together is a PAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this! Well made, packaged great, had zero scartches or dings. Was time consuming but super simple steps. I went through and did all the doors and handles first, set them aside until I got ready to place them. Very heavy duty. The only thing I didnt like was the sink didnt snap in just sets in but does make for easy wipe downs. All in all I know my nearly 5 year old will have a blast!!! Suprised in the space avalible inside refrigerator and other doors works great to store all the other extras you buy for pretend play 5 stars hands down!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very cute, broke within days
customer_reviews.text: First off let me say how cute this kitchen is, it truly is adorable. And for the 2 days my kids were able to play with it they loved it. Unfortunately it broke not even a week after it was assembled. The back bottom "leg" ripped and the kitchen could not stand stably. Absolutely ridiculous. And after going back and forth with Amazon many times about how to return this kitchen I realized it wasn't worth the hassle and had to keep it. I will not buy another KidKraft kitchen ever again and would highly recommend no one else to spend so much money on something that will break within days.
customer_reviews.author: CfromI

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly sturdy, kids LOVE it--good investment, very nice looking too
customer_reviews.text: Two 3 yr old twins have used this every day for a year now. Slamming the doors, yanking the shelves around in and out. Not a single hinge or a knob has failed, not a dent in it. Our family likes to save the best toys for the next generation, they currently play with a number of their dad's previous toys and this thing may well be up to that honor.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Noble

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome, modern and sturdy kids kitchen
customer_reviews.text: It’s such an awesome kitchen set but boy was it a PAIN to put together. It took us almost 5 hours on Christmas Eve to put it together. The directions are just pictures with arrows... no words or tips which I think could’ve helped in the more tricky parts. However, It was worth getting no sleep to see my daughters face Christmas morning!
customer_reviews.author: Alisia

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the materials was very high and the packaging was great. The parts were in individual compartments and easy ...
customer_reviews.text: This product exceeded my expectations. The quality of the materials was very high and the packaging was great. The parts were in individual compartments and easy to find and relate to the instructions. The instructions, while pictures only, were very good. The step by step construction & instructions worked out fine. The final product was solid and looked great. Construction time was about 2-3 hours for me. My only suggestion for improvement is that there are colored vs. steel fasteners. The colored fasteners should be used on the outside to match the trim, however, the instructions don't make that clear. An excellent product. I would buy from KidKraft again.
customer_reviews.author: SGF

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Had this one day and door has broken and shelf in oven!!! Cheaply made never again. My granddaughter just turned two today and She cried because it broke! Ridiculous!!! Would love $$ back. Or a return., my daughter spent 2 hours putting together.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela M.

customer_reviews.title: Really pretty, but...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3 year old for Christmas. So, 6 months ago. Its REALLY pretty but, it doesnt hold up to kids playing. My daughter and my now 10 month old son are the only ones that have played with this, and the paint has chipped off the front, and one of the doors just broke off the hinges. Neither of them are particularly rough. Daughter uses it to "cook" us food, and son likes opening and closing the doors. It should have lasted longer than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha M Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble but very sturdy and well worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is very time-consuming to assemble and the instructions come with diagrams only without words. However it is a very sturdy product and looks like a real kitchen. It is well worth the trouble. It's got plenty storage space too. My 20month old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Oge

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality in details for assembling and reaching out for resolution.
customer_reviews.text: Product packaging was ok, material has damaged ends and no touch up kit. Also the shelving predrilled holes are off thus caused the shelf to be offset. This in turn created the cams and shafts to twist and create damaged. Directions are terrible with no wording to assist. Kid Kraft you failed terribly with this unit. I am truly disappointed with the product. I only hope Kid Kraft reaches out to correct the issue or better yet Amazon needs to setup and assist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this cute kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Love this cute kitchen. It's perfect for my daughter and looks cute sitting in my kitchen. Beware: It takes about 4 hours to assemble, but it lined up perfectly and all parts were included. Also, the chalkboard is not a real chalkboard. This was a santa gift, so naturally santa wrote a message on the chalkboard with chalk markers... well, they won't wash off like they do on real chalkboards. So now the chalkboard is useless.
customer_reviews.author: K. Goza

customer_reviews.title: Move over Ikea
customer_reviews.text: If you love putting things together this is for you. SOOOO MANY PIECES, took me 3 hours to build by myself and the instructions weren't too clear on what screws to use. KidKraft uses the same letter to describe to different screws, it's very confusing, wish they could make that a little clearer. With that said, bought this for my daughter's 2nd birthday and she plays endlessly on this. It's a very cute addition to her playroom.
customer_reviews.author: Dearmrspink

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to put together, but it's worth it in the end!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to other the reviewers who cautioned to not try to put this together the night before a birthday or Christmas! My son-in-law said it took him 3 hours but the instructions were relatively easy to follow and the end result is great. Our 2 year old granddaughter loves it! She's in that stage of copying everything mom does so this will be a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: wholovessun

product_meta.title: KidKraft Uptown Espresso Kitchen – Amazon Exclusive,Multi,43 x 18 x 41
product_meta.description:
Design:SingleKidKraft uptown espresso kitchen.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Time to cook up a little fun. Our Uptown Espresso Kitchen has a hip, modern look that young chefs are sure to love. This wooden kitchen is full of fun details like a cordless phone and a chalkboard for writing the daily specials.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes one KidKraft up town espresso kitchen and assembly manual
Product dimensions: 43" x 17.75" x 41". Product weight: 74 pounds
Crafted from sturdy composite wood, MDF and plastic, this contemporary kitchen's motif simulates the dark wood and stainless steel design found in modern homes
All appliances are interactive, including doors that open and close, knobs that turn and click and a working chalkboard on the freezer door
2016 Parents choice toy of the year award

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,798 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
